titleStmt.title: S. J. Procter to James F. Robinson
CWG8629

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: A. J Denham of Edmonson County -- was fined for an Aledged Assalt & Battery -- in June 1861 before T S Sanders a Justice of the Peace for said County Two Dollars. & cost and nine days Imprisonment, from this judgment he prayed an appeal and Executed Bond before the Clerk of the Circuit Court. If process was -- Issued the sum was not returned the clerk and sherriff both resigning their offices we had neither clerk or sherriff -- from Sept 1861. to March 1862. the office was left unprotected. and many papers lost.

Denham has paid the fine & cost and Asks to be relieved from the Imprisonment. as a capias has Issued against his body -- which has not been Executed from the fact that he is a member of the 12th Ky Cavalry --

I heard the testimony upon the original trial and believe that had the case been tried upon the Appeal that he would have not only -- not have been imprisoned by the verdict of the Jury but that he would have been released from the fine also.
The imprisonment in this case is remitted the fine being already paid Jany 31 1863

$10. & nine days imprisonment
Assault
A. J. Denham
Issd Jany 31. 1863
